lead: This week, the tech world is buzzing with debates over AI ethics, new social media features, and the future of personal devices.

stories.title: Hundreds of creatives warn against an AI slop future
stories.summary: Around 800 artists, writers, and musicians have united in a campaign called 'Stealing Isn't Innovation' to protest against AI companies they accuse of stealing creative content. Notable signatories include authors George Saunders and Jodi Picoult, and musicians like R.E.M. The campaign highlights concerns over the ethical implications of AI in creative fields, emphasizing the need for proper licensing and respect for human artistry.

stories.title: X is also launching Bluesky-like starter packs
stories.summary: X, formerly known as Twitter, is introducing a feature called 'Starterpacks' that curates account recommendations for new users based on their interests. This move mirrors a similar feature from Bluesky, which allows users to create their own packs. The competition among social media platforms to enhance user experience continues as they adopt features from one another.

stories.title: How to strip AI from Chrome, Edge, and Firefox with one simple script
stories.summary: A new tool has emerged that allows users to remove unwanted AI features from popular web browsers like Chrome, Edge, and Firefox. As browsers become increasingly bloated with AI functionalities, this script offers a way to revert back to a simpler, more streamlined browsing experience, appealing to users who prioritize privacy and efficiency.

stories.title: eBay updates legalese to ban AI-powered shop-bots
stories.summary: eBay has revised its terms of service to explicitly prohibit the use of AI-powered shop-bots on its platform. This decision comes in response to concerns over fairness and the potential for automated systems to disrupt the marketplace. The move reflects a growing trend among online platforms to regulate AI usage to protect human sellers.

stories.title: Goodbye, VirtualBox - I found a better, more reliable VM manager for Linux
stories.summary: A review of Virt-Manager highlights it as a superior alternative to VirtualBox for managing virtual machines on Linux. The article discusses its user-friendly interface and reliability, making it an appealing choice for those looking to enhance their virtualization experience. This shift could influence how Linux users manage their virtual environments.

stories.title: iOS 27 may be the death of Siri as we know it, but we'll be happy with what it becomes
stories.summary: Apple is reportedly transforming Siri into a more advanced AI chatbot for iOS 27, potentially changing how users interact with their devices. This evolution aims to enhance user experience by providing more sophisticated responses and functionalities, aligning Siri more closely with competitors like OpenAI's ChatGPT.

stories.title: Testing the Claude AI coworker
stories.summary: Anthropic's new AI agent, Claude, aims to function as a collaborative coworker, integrating into workplace environments. The testing phase reveals its potential to assist with various tasks while raising questions about the future of human-AI collaboration in professional settings.

stories.title: YouTube Will Soon Let Creators Make Shorts Using Their AI Likeness
stories.summary: YouTube is set to introduce a feature allowing creators to generate Shorts using their AI likeness, positioning artificial intelligence as a tool for creative expression rather than a replacement for human input. This development could significantly alter content creation dynamics on the platform.

stories.title: Not to be outdone by OpenAI, Apple is reportedly developing an AI wearable
stories.summary: Apple is reportedly working on an AI wearable device, potentially set for release in 2027. This move signals Apple's commitment to staying competitive in the rapidly evolving AI landscape, following similar innovations by companies like OpenAI.
